text: The memorial for the Jewish Soldiers in the Polish army in World War II is a memorial dedicated to the Jews who served in the Polish Army and died in World War II. The memorial is in the National Military and Police Cemetery in Mount Herzl in Jerusalem. The memorial was built in 1998 next to the memorial for those who served in the Russian army. The memorial was built with pink stones with the symbols of the Polish army and the inscription of the years 1939-1945 next to stairs going to ceremonial plaza. it is inscribed with a Bible verse from 2 Samuel 1:23: "They were swifter than eagles, they were stronger than lions." == Other websites == * jewish military casualties in the polish armies in the world war 2 in the "zchor" website Category:Monuments and memorials in Mount Herzl Category:World War II memorials in Israel
title: Memorial for the Jewish Soldiers in the Polish army in World War II
